author: kevaundray
content:
cc <@402080271563751435> since you brang it up first

Ignacio, Francesco and Toni all agreed that for the builder attack I mentioned, the builder would need to pay for those transactions, so he is economically constrained. 

I think we can then just remove the constant I added for MAX_PAYLOAD_BLOBS and move the sentence from security considerations to rationale

content: Just one point for clarification. Should it be the builder paying or should the transactions pay. I.e. a redesign of call data costs.
